section.para: When specifying repositories in various commands, an alias, URI or repository number from the zypper repos command output can be used. A repository alias is a short version of the repository name for use in repository handling commands. Note that the repository numbers can change after modifying the list of repositories. The alias will never change by itself.

section.title: Adding repositories
section.para: URI can either be an Internet repository, a network resource, a directory or a CD or DVD (see for details). The ALIAS is a shorthand and unique identifier of the repository. You can freely choose it, with the only exception that it needs to be unique. Zypper will issue a warning if you specify an alias that is already in use.

section.title: Refreshing repositories
section.para: zypper enables you to fetch changes in packages from configured repositories. To fetch the changes, run:

note.title: Default behavior of zypper
note.para: By default, some commands perform refresh automatically, so you do not need to run the command explicitly.

section.para: The refresh command enables you to view changes also in disabled repositories, by using the --plus-content option:
This option fetches changes in repositories, but keeps the disabled repositories in the same state—disabled.

section.para: Enable or disable repositories with zypper modifyrepo. You can also alter the repository's properties (such as refreshing behavior, name or priority) with this command. The following command will enable the repository named updates, turn on auto-refresh and set its priority to 20:
Modifying repositories is not limited to a single repository—you can also operate on groups:
